castro_carazo_description:
During my studies, I developed complete web applications with modern technologies, consolidating my skills in software engineering. I learned about networks and computer architecture, gaining a deep understanding of the technological infrastructure that supports applications.

My training included an intensive focus on algorithms and data structures, solving complex problems and optimizing solutions. I also participated in group projects that simulated real work environments, strengthening my competencies in teamwork and project management.

gymapp.title: Gym App
gymapp.description:
A full-stack web application designed to manage gym memberships, user authentication, and other related functionalities. Built with a modular backend architecture and a modern frontend stack, this project is currently in its early stages of development.

The App aims to streamline gym operations by offering features such as role-based access control, user and gym entity management, and secure authentication. While the backend provides a robust and scalable foundation, the frontend offers an intuitive and responsive user interface.

features.rolePermissionManagement: Role-based access control with dynamic permissions for users such as admins, coaches, and gym members.
features.authenticationAuthorization: Secure JWT-based authentication with features for login, registration, and password recovery.
features.gymUserManagement: Functionality for creating, editing, and managing gym and user entities.
features.emailIntegration: Email services for account verification and password reset using SendGrid.
features.performanceOptimization: Caching mechanisms implemented with Redis for faster data retrieval.
features.deploymentReady: Dockerized for seamless deployment and scalability.

livepulse.title: Live Pulse
livepulse.description: This full-stack project is a live streaming platform that combines a modern frontend with React and TypeScript, and a microservice-based backend with Spring Boot. It allows users to stream videos, interact via real-time chat, follow streamers, and manage profiles. The system emphasizes an event-driven architecture, real-time communication, and scalability.

features.realTimeInteraction: Real-time chat based on WebSocket/STOMP with persistence in MongoDB via Kafka, audience metrics with Redis, and event-driven notifications powered by Kafka.
features.streamManagement: RTMP/HLS video streaming with transcoding using Nginx-RTMP and FFmpeg, thumbnail generation with FFmpeg, and metadata storage in MongoDB.
features.userExperience: Streamer following system with real-time updates, profile management, and responsive design with Tailwind CSS.
features.eventDrivenArchitecture: Use of Kafka for message flows and stream lifecycle, and Redis Pub/Sub for metrics updates.
features.scalableMicroservices: Scalable microservices with Docker and Kafka.
features.hybridCommunication: Hybrid communication (WebSocket + SSE + Redis) to balance performance and complexity.
features.dataPersistence: Resilient data persistence, such as chat messages stored post-stream to reduce load.
features.adaptiveStreaming: Adaptive streaming with HLS/DASH to ensure dynamic quality.
features.productionReady: Production practices like API testing with Postman, CORS configuration, and monitoring with Spring Boot Actuator.
features.mobileFirstDesign: Mobile-first design with Tailwind CSS and performance optimizations with React Query.
